image.altText: Collage of a man in a polaroid frame with Vote No signage, Jacinta Nampijinpa Price and Warren Mundine

items.synopsis: The biggest known donor to the Advance Australia campaign group has backed a conspiracy theorist political candidate and holds a business interest in Indigenous land ventures.

title.children: Meet Simon Fenwick, the former Wall Street investor funding the No campaign

image.altText: Young Palestinian men and a middle-aged woman walk past smoking concrete wreckage on a city street.

items.synopsis: The Israeli defence force says rocket sirens are sounding in Tel Aviv and across the rest of the country, as Hamas warns people to leave the Israeli city of Ashkelon.

title.children: Sirens sound in Tel Aviv as Hamas issues threat to Ashkelon

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Two hours ago Hamas issued a warning to those in the Israeli city of Ashkelon. Now the deadline has passed footage shows rockets are being fired out of Israel into Gaza.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Heavy rocket barrage on Ashkelon after Hamas deadline passes

props.alt: Streams of smoke coming out of a building.

children.content: Two hours ago Hamas issued a warning to those in the Israeli city of Ashkelon.
Now the deadline has passed footage shows rockets are being fired out of Israel into Gaza.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Two members from Hamas' political office, Jawad Abu Shammala an d Zakaria Abu Maamar, were killed in an air strike in Khan Younis in southern Gaza Strip, an official from the group told Reuters. In separate statements, the Israeli military confirmed killing Abu Shammala and Abu Maamar, saying they had been struck overnight. The Israeli Embassy in the US reports the death toll from attacks by Hamas has risen to more than 1000. At least 770 Gazans have since been killed in Israeli strikes, according to Gaza officials
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Members from Hamas' political office killed in air stike as death toll rises

children.content: Two members from Hamas' political office,
were killed in an air strike in Khan Younis in southern Gaza Strip, an official from the group told Reuters.
In separate statements, the Israeli military confirmed killing Abu Shammala and Abu Maamar, saying they had been struck overnight.
The Israeli Embassy in the US reports the death toll from attacks by Hamas has risen to
have since been killed in Israeli strikes, according to Gaza officials

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Israel Defense Forces has just reported rocket sirens sounding in Tel Aviv and across the country.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Sirens sounding in Tel Aviv and across Israel: IDF

children.content: The Israel Defense Forces has just reported rocket sirens sounding in Tel Aviv and across the country.

image.altText: new south wales police officers stand on the steps of sydney's opera house during a pro-palestine rally

items.synopsis: No-one has been arrested over the use of flares at the rally but officers are investigating the behaviour of those in the crowd.

title.children: Police defend 'lamentable' advice to Jewish community ahead of Sydney pro-Palestinian rally

items.synopsis: Satellite and drone imagery capture the aftermath of the ongoing fighting in Israel and Gaza.

title.children: These hotspots dotted across southern Israel reveal the scale of attacks

image.altText: Mustafa Barghouti

items.synopsis: A Palestinian political leader says terrorist group Hamas is ready to free civilian hostages if Israel accepts an immediate ceasefire, claiming the militants have agreed not to carry out executions.

title.children: Palestinian politician claims Hamas ready to swap hostages

image.altText: Vanessa Amorosi wearing a black pant suit with her hair tied back and glasses walking out of court

items.synopsis: Australian pop star Vanessa Amorosi is suing her mother over the way she managed her finances at the height of her career in the early 2000s.

title.children: Pop star Vanessa Amorosi sues her mother over property ownership

image.altText: Emergency tape surrounding a pole that a black car has crashed into

items.synopsis: A 100-year-old woman and a 75-year-old man died after the car crashed into a power pole in Sydney's western suburbs this morning, while another man was killed in a separate incident.

title.children: Three people, including a 100-year-old woman, die after two separate Sydney crashes

image.altText: a man wearing a suit arriving at a court and looking at the camera

items.synopsis: A Federal Court judge orders the war veteran to pay a security to cover Nine Entertainment's court costs ahead of appeal against landmark defamation loss.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith ordered to pay $910k before appeal over war crimes defamation decision

image.altText: A simple wooden cross in the ground at an outback cemetery.

items.synopsis: Advocates say access to mental health services needs to be urgently improved after an ABS report reveals an increase in tragedy all too common in First Nations communities.

title.children: 'It's in your face': Shocking figures reveal leading cause of death for Indigenous children

image.altText: Black and white portrait of Ernest Young

items.synopsis: An inquiry into suspected gay hate deaths hears a handprint has yielded a match to a man who could have been involved in the 1976 murder of Ernest Allan Head, but evidence like saliva on cigarette butts, and human hair, has been lost.

title.children: Bloody handprint re-tested 47 years after case murder 'powerfully indicates' culprit, inquiry told

image.altText: Older man and woman with rubble dust on their face inside a vehicle

items.synopsis: A total blockade of food, water, electricity and other goods has been ordered in Israel's retaliation against Hamas. So what does that mean for struggling Palestinians?

title.children: 'Utter disaster': How a complete siege could break an already crippled Gaza

image.altText: A boy next to a burning vehicle.

items.synopsis: The Palestinian gunmen who launched deadly attacks on Israel are not Iranian puppets — but they are doing the work Iran wants done, writes Aaron Pilkington.

title.children: There are at least three possible outcomes to the Hamas-Israel war. They all play in Iran's favour

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese on ABC's Afternoon Briefing, speaking from Uluru

items.synopsis: Look back at our live coverage of the Voice to Parliament campaign on Tuesday, October 10.

title.children: Anthony Albanese says race is far from over as 3.3 million pre-polls cast in Voice referendum — as it happened

image.altText: A low shot looking up at a sign on the side of Perth Children's Hospital.

items.synopsis: A new report reveals there were four serious sexual safety incidents reported by children and young people receiving mental healthcare in WA in the last financial year. It follows shocking allegations of a teenager being raped by a fellow patient at Perth Children's Hospital.

title.children: New report reveals number of 'sexual safety incidents' involving children in wake of alleged PCH rape

image.altText: an elderly woman in sunglasses smiling

items.synopsis: A jury has been told a man who allegedly drove a getaway car after the shooting death of a Newcastle grandmother was part of a targeted killing.

title.children: Murder trial hears Newcastle grandmother shot dead after slapping daughter's partner

image.altText: A man's hand holding a baby little penguin.

items.synopsis: When two little penguins recently came ashore on NSW's far south coast and mated they were, without knowing it, pioneers in re-establishing a colony that had been locally extinct for decades.

title.children: Australian-first 'love machine' helps re-colonise little penguin population locally extinct for 30 years

image.altText: A man carries a young boy down the street amidst emergency services personnel and rubble.

items.synopsis: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vows to "change the Middle East" while Hamas threatens to broadcast the execution of captives in return for every Israeli bombing of a civilian house without warning.

title.children: Netanyahu vows to 'change the Middle East' as Hamas threatens to execute captive Israelis

image.altText: A woman holds her head in her hand as she openly sobbed, while another woman consoles her

items.synopsis: Hamas has held Israeli civilians and soldiers captive before, but history shows this hostage situation could be much more difficult for Israel to resolve.

title.children: Civilians and soldiers are among those held hostage by Hamas. How did they capture so many?

image.altText: People search for bodies in debris at night.

items.synopsis: Women and children were among the dozens killed and injured in Myanmar's Kachin state, in one of the deadliest attacks on civilians since the return of military rule.

title.children: Dozens killed in one of the deadliest attacks on civilians since return of Myanmar military rule

image.altText: Golfer Adam Scott stands looking down the fairway with his caddie holding his set of clubs during a tournament.

items.synopsis: Former world number one golfer Adam Scott joins the stellar fields for the Australian Open and Australian PGA Championship this summer.

title.children: Adam Scott returns home to chase his childhood dreams in summer of golf

image.altText: People collecting flowers and teddy bears outside a primary school.

items.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge rules a workplace safety investigation cannot be provided to the coroner investigating the tragedy while there is a possibility of criminal proceedings.

title.children: Almost two years on, court decision means Hillcrest jumping castle inquest still can't proceed

image.altText: A side by side image of a father dressed in a hat and a son dressed in a suit

items.synopsis: Air crash investigators examining the light plane crash that claimed the lives of SA men Ben and Charlie Mumford say initial evidence corroborates reports the aircraft hit a powerline while attempting to land.

title.children: Plane crash that killed father and son caused by powerline strike, early ATSB evidence suggests

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A white fish with large brown spots, and small brown and orange spots on its fins.

items.synopsis: The Lady Elliot shrimp goby is the first new fish species discovered on the reef since 2019, much to the delight of the researchers who stumbled across it by chance.

title.children: Completely new fish species found 'in plain sight' on Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: A woman pushes Natasha Fyles with one hand and pushes a paper plate into her face with the other hand

items.synopsis: Suzanne Milgate is accused of hitting Chief Minister Natasha Fyles in the face with a cream-covered crepe.

title.children: Woman accused of 'cream crepe' attack on chief minister fronts court for the first time

image.altText: a woman sitting in an electric wheelchair outside a voting centre.

items.synopsis: A woman who uses an electric wheelchair says she was left feeling like a "lesser person" when she and others were unable to enter a pre-polling venue to cast votes in the Voice to Parliament referendum.

title.children: Woman forced to vote in car after 'undignified experience' at inaccessible early polling venue

image.altText: Composite image of two young men, with police behind them.

items.synopsis: Brothers Aran and Ari Sherani are on trial for terror-related offences, with prosecutors alleging they were motivated by extremist religious ideology when they planned to light deadly bushfires on Melbourne's outskirts in 2021.

title.children: Victorian jury shown videos of man pledging allegiance to Islamic State, lighting fires

image.altText: CCTV shows 'chaotic' daylight shooting in suburban Perth

items.synopsis: A second man is charged after a video is released by police showing a series of gunshots being fired in a residential street in Perth's south.

title.children: Dramatic vision of gunfire erupting in suburban street in broad daylight released by police

image.altText: Sold

items.synopsis: More than 1,300 representatives are attending a three-day National Housing Conference in Brisbane to address difficulties and find solutions for the future of housing in Australia.

title.children: Housing market is now 'too difficult for many Australians', National Housing Conference hears

image.altText: Composite image of Natasha Wanganeen and James Stevens

items.synopsis: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price was not on ABC's Q+A but a colleague's defence of her comments on colonisation drew a heated response as the Voice referendum looms large.

title.children: 'Disgusting language': Heated clash over colonisation and Jacinta Price dominates Q+A

image.altText: People search for survivors amid the debris of a house that was destroyed by an earthquake.

items.synopsis: The Taliban administration said at least 2,400 Afghans have been killed and thousands of homes destroyed in Saturday's magnitude-6.3 earthquake and its strong aftershocks.

title.children: 'Most of the people are under the rubble': Rescuers rush to save survivors of Afghanistan earthquakes

image.altText: Man looking in mirror .

items.synopsis: The Victorian Coroner foreshadows he will be asking police to explain why officers were not wearing body cameras when they fatally shot Stanley Turvey after a three-day manhunt.

title.children: Court hears fugitive told armed police, 'I'm going to shoot you, or you're going to shoot me'

image.altText: Woman with brown hair sits in hospital bed. She is wearing mask.

items.synopsis: With just her bare hands, Jenny Forward picked up a platypus in a roadside gutter she thought needed rescuing. She says within seconds she knew it was a "big mistake".

title.children: Woman spurred by platypus continues rescue mission, later undergoes surgery

image.altText: RFK Jr is pictured between two American flags. He looks at the camera and smiles

items.synopsis: Robert F Kennedy Jr abandons the party of his family dynasty and his bid for the Democratic presidential nomination, announcing he's running for election as an independent — a possible boost for Donald Trump.

title.children: 'His candidacy is an embarrassment': The Kennedy blowing up Camelot
